metadata.title: Social Media Silences NSA Debate
metadata.description: Willingness to join conversations about government surveillance
metadata.main_insight: People are more willing to discuss government surveillance in person than on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter.  A significant portion of respondents are unwilling to discuss the topic in any of the presented contexts.

datafacts.annotation: At a community meeting has highest Value
datafacts.reason: At a community meeting has the highest Value at 41.0

datafacts.annotation: At a family dinner has lowest Value
datafacts.reason: At a family dinner has the lowest Value at 12.0

datafacts.annotation: Gap between highest and lowest is 29.0
datafacts.reason: The difference between the highest value (41.0) and lowest value (12.0) is 29.0
The average Value across all Context values is 25.0
The Value shows considerable variation across different Context values, with a range of 29.0
